diagrams.title: Register Account

threats.title: Input Validation Bypass (OWASP ID: A7:2017-Cross-Site Scripting (XSS))
threats.description: Provide a description for this threat
threats.mitigation: Implement server-side input validation, use secure coding practices, encode output

threats.title: DOS (OWASP ID: A10:2017-Insufficient Logging & Monitoring)
threats.description: Attackers flood the registration system with a large volume of registration requests, causing service degradation or denial of service.
threats.mitigation: Implement rate limiting, use CDN (Content Delivery Network) or WAF (Web Application Firewall), monitor server performance and network traffic.

threats.title: SQL Injection (OWASP ID: A1:2017-Injection)
threats.description: Attackers inject SQL commands into the registration form's input fields, attempting to manipulate or compromise the database.
threats.mitigation: Use parameterized queries, implement input validation and sanitization, regularly update and patch software.

threats.title: Insecure CAPTCHA Implementation (OWASP ID: A6:2017-Security Misconfiguration)
threats.description: Weak or poorly implemented CAPTCHA can be bypassed by automated scripts or attackers.
threats.mitigation: Use strong CAPTCHA mechanisms, regularly update and monitor CAPTCHA effectiveness, combine CAPTCHA with other anti-automation measures.

threats.title: Insufficient Anti-Automation (OWASP ID: A1:2017-Injection)
threats.description: Attackers use automated tools or scripts to submit a large volume of fraudulent registrations.
threats.mitigation: Implement CAPTCHA, rate limiting, and behavioral analysis to detect and block automated registration attempts.

diagrams.description: I want to register a new account, using an email and password.

diagrams.title: Change Password

threats.title: DDOS
threats.description: Provide a description for this threat
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: XSS OWASP-ID-003
threats.description: Injecting malicious scripts that could manipulate the password change process or steal new passwords.
threats.mitigation: Implement input validation, output encoding, and Content Security Policy (CSP).

threats.title: Insecure Password Storage OWASP-ID-009
threats.description: New passwords stored in plaintext or weakly hashed form, making them susceptible to theft.
threats.mitigation: Use strong cryptographic hashing and salt passwords before storing them.

threats.title: Insufficient Transport Layer Protection OWASP-ID-008
threats.description: Lack of HTTPS or weak encryption could expose the new password during transmission.
threats.mitigation: Implement HTTPS with strong encryption, use HSTS (HTTP Strict Transport Security), and avoid mixed content.

threats.title: Insecure Password Recovery OWASP-ID-010
threats.description: Weak or easily guessable password recovery mechanisms that allow unauthorized password changes.
threats.mitigation: Implement secure password change processes with multi-factor authentication and security questions.

threats.title: Insufficient Logging and Monitoring OWASP-ATC-004
threats.description: Inability to detect and alert on suspicious password change attempts or patterns
threats.mitigation: Implement comprehensive logging, monitoring, and alerting mechanisms for password change events.

diagrams.description: As a Client, I want to change the password of my account

diagrams.title: Sign In

threats.title: Nova ameaça STRIDE
threats.description: Provide a description for this threat
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: XSS OWASP-ID-003
threats.description: Injecting malicious scripts into the sign-in page that could steal user credentials or perform actions on behalf of the user.
threats.mitigation: Implement input validation, output encoding, and Content Security Policy (CSP)

threats.title: Brute Force Attack
threats.description: Threat actors might attempt to guess or brute force credentials to gain unauthorized access.
threats.mitigation: Use CAPTCHA or multi-factor authentication (MFA) to prevent automated brute force attacks.

threats.title: Credential Stuffing
threats.description: Attackers use previously leaked credentials from other services to gain unauthorized access.
threats.mitigation: Monitor for unusual login patterns and implement MFA.

threats.title: Man-in-the-Middle (MitM) Attack
threats.description: An attacker intercepts communication between the client and server to capture login credentials.
threats.mitigation: Implement HTTPS with strong encryption.

threats.title: Insecure Password Storage  OWASP-ID-009
threats.description: Passwords stored in plaintext or weakly hashed form, making them susceptible to theft.
threats.mitigation:
Hash passwords using strong cryptographic algorithms (e.g., bcrypt, Argon2).
Use salts and implement password stretching.

threats.title: Inadequate Account Lockout OWASP-ATC-003
threats.description: Lack of or ineffective account lockout mechanism could allow brute force attacks to continue without detection
threats.mitigation: Implement account lockout after a specified number of failed attempts and provide recovery options for legitimate users.

threats.title: Insider Threats OWASP-ATC-005
threats.description: Malicious insiders with access to the system might misuse their privileges to compromise user accounts.
threats.mitigation: Implement least privilege access controls, monitor insider activities, and conduct regular security awareness training.

threats.title: Account Enumeration OWASP-ID-011
threats.description: OWASP-ID-011
threats.mitigation: Implement generic error messages, use rate limiting on login attempts, and avoid revealing user-specific information.

diagrams.description: As a Client, I want to sign in

diagrams.title: Add product to the shopping cart

threats.title: XSS (OWASP ID: A7:2017-Cross-Site Scripting (XSS))
threats.description: Attackers inject malicious scripts into the product details or shopping cart pages, potentially stealing user information or executing unauthorized actions.
threats.mitigation: Implement input validation and output encoding, use Content Security Policy (CSP), sanitize user-generated content.

threats.title: Insecure Direct Object References (IDOR) (OWASP ID: A4:2017-Insecure Direct Object References)
threats.description: Attackers manipulate product identifiers or URLs to access other users' shopping cart items or product details.
threats.mitigation: Implement proper access controls and authorization checks, use indirect object references, validate user permissions.

threats.title: Insecure Deserialization (OWASP ID: A8:2017-Insecure Deserialization)
threats.description: Attackers exploit insecure deserialization to manipulate the data structure or execute arbitrary code when adding a product to the shopping cart.
threats.mitigation: Avoid using insecure deserialization, validate and sanitize serialized data, use strong data integrity checks.

threats.title: Denial of Inventory (OWASP ID: A10:2017-Insufficient Logging & Monitoring)
threats.description: Attackers flood the system with requests to add products to the shopping cart, causing inventory depletion or service degradation.
threats.mitigation: Implement rate limiting, monitor inventory levels, use CDN (Content Delivery Network) or WAF (Web Application Firewall).

threats.title: Broken Access Control (OWASP ID: A5:2017-Broken Access Control)
threats.description: Lack of proper access controls might allow attackers to add products to the shopping cart without proper authorization.
threats.mitigation: Implement access controls and authorization checks, validate user permissions, use session management best practices.

diagrams.description: As a Client, I want to add product to the shopping cart

diagrams.title: Checkout the Shopping Cart
diagrams.description: As a Client I want to checkout the Shopping Cart
